meanings.definition: Not yielding profit or financial gain.
meanings.sent1: The lemonade stand was unprofitable because no one wanted to buy the warm drinks.
meanings.sent2: Investing in that failing company turned out to be unprofitable in the long run.
meanings.sent3: It was unprofitable to try selling ice cream in the middle of a snowstorm.
meanings.sent4: Her attempt to make a profit from selling seashells by the seashore proved unprofitable.
meanings.sent5: The decision to open a ski resort in a desert was clearly unprofitable.

meanings.sent1: Eating too much candy is unprofitable for your health.
meanings.sent2: Skipping breakfast is unprofitable as it can lead to low energy levels.
meanings.sent3: It would be unprofitable to wear a winter coat in the scorching summer heat.
meanings.sent4: Holding onto grudges is as unprofitable as carrying a heavy burden.
meanings.sent5: Procrastination is an unprofitable habit that often leads to stress.
